abstract: Jury in criminal trial of Dewey & LeBoeuf law firm executives Steven H Davis, Stephen DiCarmine and Joel Sanders tells New York Supreme Court Justice Robert Stolz it cannot come to unanimous agreement on majority of counts against them; executives are accused of accounting fraud that resulted in loss of tens of millions of dollars for banks and insurance firms.
lead_paragraph: The judge must decide the next step after the jury sent a note saying they were unable to come to an unanimous agreement on a majority of counts.

headline.main: Dewey & LeBoeuf Jurors Tell Judge They Are Stuck After 13 Days of Deliberation
headline.print_headline: Dewey Jurors Tell Judge They’re Stuck After 13 Days of Deliberation

snippet: The judge must decide the next step after the jury sent a note saying they were unable to come to an unanimous agreement on a majority of counts.
